thread.title: Crystal Palace fans accidentally vandalise own team bus after mix up | Metro News
thread.title_full: Crystal Palace fans accidentally vandalise own team bus after mix up | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Crystal Palace fans accidentally vandalise own team bus after mix up | Metro News
text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 11:30 am The team bus was targeted by vandals (Twitter) 
Vandals defaced Crystal Palace ‚Äôs team bus over the weekend, apparently confusing it for the opposition team‚Äôs vehicle. 
Ahead of the Premier League meeting between Palace and Middlesbrough, mischief-makers daubed ‚ÄòCRYSTAL PALACE FC‚Äô in huge letters down the side of a bus which was parked at a hotel near Selhurst Park. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
However rather than it belonging to visitors Middlesbrough, the bus was Crystal Palace‚Äôs own. 
Crystal Palace‚Äôs assistant head groundsman, Dean Waters, posted images of the graffiti and a message on Twitter. 
‚Äò¬£40,000 worth of damage on our coach thinking it was the Boro coach. Nice one! #cpfc,‚Äô he tweeted, before changing his privacy settings on the social media site. 
However images of the graffiti began to circulate‚Ä¶ Palace fans vandalise what they think is the boro coach. But boro flew down and borrowed one of the palace coaches causing ¬£40k of damage üòÖüòÖ pic.twitter.com/SsXn6F6KoR 
‚Äî Rich Cook (@Rickyc1234) February 26, 2017 
Crystal Palace confirmed the incident on Sunday, telling Sun Sport: ‚ÄòThe team bus was covered in graffiti with the words ‚ÄúCrystal Palace‚Äù overnight on Friday ahead of the game on Saturday. Police have been informed.‚Äô
